Ne mogu kopirati ili premjestiti poruke koje nisu sinhronizirane sa serverom

Server ukazuje na nevažeći SSL certifikat. Ponekad je to zbog loše konfiguracije servera. Ponekad je zbog toga što neko pokušava napasi vas ili vaš server. Ako niste sigurni o čemu se radi, kliknite Odbij i kontaktirajte ljude koji upravljaju vašim serverem pošte.\n\n(%s)
ne mogu se povezati na server.\n(%s)

Del (or D) - Obriši
R - Odgovori
A - Odgovori Svima
C - Sastavi
F - Proslijedi
M - Premjesti
V - Arhiviraj
Y - Kopiraj
Z - Označi (Ne)pročitano
G - Zvjezdica
O - Sortiranje vrste
I - Poredak sortiranja
Q - Povratak na foldere
S - Označi/ukloni oznaku
J or P - Prethodna poruka
K or N - Sljedeća poruka

1 - Prikaži samo foldere 1. nivoa
2 - Prikaži foldere 1. i 2. nivoa
3 - Prikaži sve osim foldera 2. nivoa
4 - Prikaži sve foldere
Q - Povratak na email račune
S - Ispravi postavke email računa

Ne mogu identificirati. Server ne prijavljuje mogućnost SASL pristupa. To može biti problem sa certifikatom klijenta (istekao, nepoznat izdavatelj certifikata) ili neki drugi konfiguracijski problem.
Neuspješno dobivanje certifikata klijenta za alias \"%s\"
Certifikat klijenta \"%1$s\" je istekao ili još nije važeći (%2$s)
Kliknite \'Preuzimanje cijele poruke\' za omogućavanje dekripcije.

Because of this, support for APG has been removed from K9 Mail.
You can click here to learn more.
This email has been encrypted with OpenPGP.\nTo read it, you need to install and configure a compatible OpenPGP App.
Use UTC instead of local timezone in mail headers and reply header
This part was not encrypted, and may be insecure.
Encrypted message must be downloaded for decryption.
Signatures may be displayed as \'signature.asc\' attachments in some clients.
Signatures may break when sent to mailing lists.
Encrypted messages always include a signature.
This does not encrypt the email, but verifies that it was sent from your key.
In this mode, your PGP key will be used to create a cryptographic signature of an unencrypted email.
Some clients only support this format
The email is sent in PGP/INLINE format.\nThis should only be used for compatibility:
No Drafts folder configured for this account!
No key configured for signing! Please check your settings.
Private mode is enabled, but some recipients do not have keys!
Message is encrypted, but decryption was cancelled.
Message is encrypted, but there was a decryption error.
Message was encrypted, but not signed.
Message is encrypted, but must be fully downloaded for decryption.
Message must be fully downloaded to verify its signature.
Message is signed, but the signature could not be verified.
Message is signed, but not encrypted.
There is no signature, this message may have been intercepted.
Message is encrypted, but in an unsupported format.
Message is signed, but in an unsupported format.
Subject is empty, click again to send anyway
PGP/INLINE mode does not support attachments!
Cannot connect to crypto provider, check your settings or click crypto icon to retry!
Crypto provider access denied, click crypto icon to retry!
The attachment could not be saved as there is not enough space.
There was an error in this message\'s signature!
This message was signed by an expired key!
This message was signed by an insecure key!
This message was signed by a revoked key!
This message was encrypted, but not signed. It is not end-to-end secure!
Authentication failed for %s. Update your server settings.
Special characters are currently not supported!
Tap circle or star for unread or starred messages

K9 Mail is a powerful free email client for Android.

Its improved features include:

  • Push mail using IMAP IDLE
  • Better performance
  • Message refiling
  • Email signatures
  • Bcc-to-self
  • Folder subscriptions
  • All folder synchronization
  • Return-address configuration
  • Keyboard shortcuts
  • Better IMAP support
  • Saving attachments to SD
  • Empty Trash
  • Message sorting
  • …and more

Please note that K9 does not support most free Hotmail accounts and, like many mail clients, has some quirks when talking to Microsoft Exchange.

Please submit bug reports, contribute new features and ask questions at https://github.com/hernad/K9-android/.
No OpenPGP app configured, see global settings!
Messages will normally be encrypted by choice, or when replying to an encrypted message.
If both sender and recipients enable mutual mode, encryption will be enabled by default.
